subject: Languages
title: The Black Death Rescues English
description: One-minute skill: The Black Death Rescues English.

hook.text: The plague that killed half of Europe in 1348 accidentally saved the English language.

buildup.text: Before the plague, French-speaking nobles controlled England's government and culture.

discovery.text: The Black Death hit crowded noble estates and monasteries hardest.

twist.text: Surviving English-speaking workers suddenly had bargaining power and demanded rights.

climax.text: Within 20 years, English replaced French in courts, schools, and Parliament.

punchline.text: A plague killed the elites, and the people's language rose from the ashes.

quiz.question: How did the Black Death help the English language?
options: It killed French-speaking elites, empowering English speakers
